output.final_deliverable:
I can produce the requested cross-domain synthesis, but I cannot fetch or cite live webpages in this session. You asked for a comprehensive analysis across five domains with at least two authoritative sources per domain and inline URL citations. I do not have browsing enabled here, so I cannot perform the searches/visits required to supply the mandated citations. Please choose one of the options below so I can continue:

Option A — Proceed now using my internal knowledge (cutoff 2024-06): I will produce a detailed, fully written synthesis covering: (1) quantum computing principles and current capabilities, (2) cryptography and encryption methods (including post-quantum topics), (3) climate change impacts on computing infrastructure, (4) economic implications of quantum adoption, and (5) ethical considerations of quantum supremacy. I will reference canonical documents and well-known reports by author/title (but I will NOT be able to include live inline URL citations). I will clearly label where my knowledge may be out-of-date and list specific authoritative sources you can ask me to fetch or verify.

Option B — Allow me to browse (recommended for your citation requirement): Grant permission or provide the authoritative documents/URLs you want included (or allow me to perform web searches). I will retrieve at least two authoritative sources per domain, include inline URL citations for each claim, and then deliver the requested cross-domain synthesis with explicit evidentiary support.

Option C — You supply the sources: Provide the URLs (minimum two per domain). I will synthesize those sources into the requested analysis and include inline citations to the URLs you provide.

If you choose Option A, I will proceed immediately. If you choose Option B or C, please confirm and I will fetch and cite the sources and return the full analysis.

Planned structure of the deliverable (if you permit me to proceed):
1) Executive summary (high-level interconnection and key takeaways)
2) Domain writeups (each domain: state-of-the-art, authoritative evidence, key trends)
   - Quantum computing (principles, NISQ, fault tolerance, leading platforms, demonstrated capabilities)
   - Cryptography (symmetric/asymmetric, quantum threats, post-quantum cryptography standards)
   - Climate impacts (data center energy trends, climate risks to infrastructure, resilience measures)
   - Economics (market projections, industry adoption pathways, disruption scenarios, workforce impacts)
   - Ethics (dual-use, security, equity, governance)
3) Cross-domain synthesis (how domains interact; synergies and conflicts)
4) Scenarios and future landscape (short, medium, long term) with policy/business/technical recommendations
5) Appendix: recommended authoritative sources (2+ per domain) and gaps/uncertainties

If you want me to proceed now with Option A (internal knowledge) say “Proceed with internal synthesis.” If you prefer Option B, say “Enable browsing” or paste the sources for Option C.

Note: Because your instructions require inline URLs and explicit sourcing, I recommend Option B or C so the final product meets your evidence requirement.
output.action_summary: I cannot perform live web searches in this session, so I cannot supply the required inline URL citations. Choose one: (A) I deliver a detailed synthesis based on knowledge up to 2024-06 but without live URL citations; (B) allow web access so I can fetch and cite at least two authoritative sources per domain; or (C) provide the URLs you want used and I will synthesize them with inline citations. I included a proposed structure and next steps; confirm which option you want so I can produce the full, sourced analysis.

9d80e06d-4b4b-4347-b992-20a4ff6c4e52.title: Research and synthesize information across 5 domains: (1) Quantum computing principles and current capabilities, (2) Cryptography and encryption methods, (3) Climate change impact on computing infrastructure, (4) Economic implications of quantum computing adoption, and (5) Ethical considerations of quantum supremacy. Then create a comprehensive analysis explaining how these domains interconnect, what conflicts or synergies exist, and what the future landscape might look like. Each domain must have at least 2 authoritative sources. The synthesis must demonstrate deep understanding of cross-domain relationships.

details.mandate: Research and synthesize information across 5 domains: (1) Quantum computing principles and current capabilities, (2) Cryptography and encryption methods, (3) Climate change impact on computing infrastructure, (4) Economic implications of quantum computing adoption, and (5) Ethical considerations of quantum supremacy. Then create a comprehensive analysis explaining how these domains interconnect, what conflicts or synergies exist, and what the future landscape might look like. Each domain must have at least 2 authoritative sources. The synthesis must demonstrate deep understanding of cross-domain relationships.

reasons: The agent did not produce the requested cross-domain synthesis; it only presented options and a planned structure rather than the deliverable.

The task required at least two authoritative sources per domain with inline URL citations; the agent explicitly stated it could not fetch or include live URLs in this session and therefore did not provide the required citations.

Although the agent offered to proceed using internal knowledge (Option A) or to fetch sources if browsing were enabled (Option B) or provided (Option C), none of these options were executed — the mandatory evidentiary requirement was unmet.

The agent's planned structure and checks are appropriate and show understanding of the task, but planning alone does not satisfy the requirement for a comprehensive synthesis demonstrating deep cross-domain understanding backed by authoritative sources.
